column6: Prevention and mitigation of occupational health and safety impacts directly linked by business relationships
column13: Transurban is in its third year working under its HSE Contractor Management Framework that embeds HSE analytics into its risk reporting and analysis. This approach, designed to improve Transurban's overall understanding, identification and management of hazards, risks, incidents and near misses, has improved contractor HSE performance.
column20: HSE Contractor Management Framework, risk reporting, hazard

column6: Workers covered by an occupational health and safety management system
column7: Transurban has a Health and Safety Management System aligned to ISO 45001 Occupational Health and Safety Management Systems that addresses the activities undertaken by employees and other workers, where works are under the management control of Transurban.

column6: Work-related injuries
Work-related ill health
column7: Transurban had a 2.2% absentee rate for its male workers in Victoria.

column6: Average hours of training per year per employee
column7: Transurban's average training hours in 2023 were 5 hours per entry-level employee.

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Transurban people are encouraged to undertake self-directed learning for the skills that will help them in their careers. More than 86% of Transurban's direct employees have activated their LinkedIn Learning account, 6% higher than similar organisations. Transurban's annual performance and development cycle supports meaningful career conversations and planning, with 83% of employees having set formal development goals throughout the year.
column20: LinkedIn Learning, self-directed learning, performance and development cycle

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: The Strategic Leadership Program is a partnership program with the Stanford Graduate School of Business for several of Transurban's senior leaders. The program focuses on developing the capability of senior leaders to shape and pursue strategic and cultural ambitions.
column20: Strategic Leadership Program, Stanford Graduate School of Business, senior leader

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: The Business Leadership Program is a seven-month program for mid to senior-level leaders. It focuses on enterprise leadership capability creating strategic impact.
column20: Business Leadership Program, senior-level leader, enterprise leadership

column6: Percentage of employees receiving regular performance and career development reviews
column7: All employees are expected to have performance and development conversations throughout the year, with 83% of employees having set formal development goals.

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: As a 'relevant employer' and as required by the Workplace Gender Equality Act (2012), Transurban lodged its Workplace Gender Profile as of March 2023 with the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA). Transurban also has a longstanding endorsement as an 'Employer of Choice for Gender Equality' by WGEA.
column20: Workplace Gender Profile, WGEA, relevant employer

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Transurban has a Diversity and Inclusion Policy that includes a requirement for the Board to set measurable objectives for achieving diversity and inclusion and annually review the objectives and progress in achieving them.
column20: Diversity and Inclusion Policy, measurable objective, progress

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Transurban's largest NSW maintenance supplier, Ventia, delivers landscaping works on the Hills M2 Motorway. Last year, two Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander apprentices joined the team. Both workers were employed through a partnership between Transurban, Ventia and Muru Mittigar. This Dharug-controlled social enterprise connects First Nations peoples with jobs and supports them in managing their work, study, individual challenges, and community responsibilities.

column6: Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
column7: Transurban's gender pay ratio in its US operations was 49:51.

column6: Incidents of discrimination and corrective actions taken
column13: Transurban strives to prevent and ultimately eliminate inappropriate workplace behaviour, including sexual harassment and bullying. All employees must undertake annual training on equal opportunity and sexual harassment as part of Transurban's Respect@Work program. Transurban responds if issues arise, and its approach is victim-centric and trauma-informed.

column4: Freedom of Association and Collective Bargaining
column6: Operations and suppliers in which the right to freedom of association and collective bargaining may be at risk
column7: Transurban operates in Australia, the United States and Canada, where freedom of association and collective bargaining are protected by law and fully supported by employee and supply chain policies. Transurban has 5.3% of employees covered by collective bargaining agreements.

column6: Operations and suppliers at significant risk for incidents of child labor
column13: In FY23, Transurban refreshed its Contract Management Framework. The updated framework is designed to support Transurban's people in making responsible and sustainable goods and services purchases and covers every stage of the procurement process. More than 70 people completed training in Transurban's contract management processes.
column20: Contract Management Framework, sustainable goods, contract management process

column6: Operations and suppliers ar significant risk for incidents of forced or compulsory labor
column13: Transurban knows reliable and on-time cashflows help small businesses grow and support their people. Transurban remains committed to the Business Council of Australia's (BCA) Supplier Payment Code, agreeing to pay eligible Australian small businesses on time and within 30 days. In the first half of FY23, Transurban paid 99% of Australian small businesses within 30 days of invoicing.
column20: Supplier Payment Code, small business, on-time cashflow

column6: Security personnel trained in human rights policies or procedures
column13: Transurban engaged Anti-Slavery Australia to develop and pilot training for its Traffic Control Room Officers (TCRO) and the Incident Response Crews (IRC) on the Eastern Distributor and Cross City Tunnels in Sydney. This training had been deferred due to COVID-19 restrictions, but this in-person training could be delivered by easing social distancing rules in 2022. The training content included initial awareness and an overview of what constitutes modern slavery, examples of modern slavery cases in Australia, and examples of modern slavery instances on motorways worldwide.
column20: Anti-Slavery Australia, pilot training, modern slavery

column6: Security personnel trained in human rights policies or procedures
column13: Transurban conducted training for its Vendor Management team, which included refreshing their basic awareness of modern slavery, Transurban's legal obligations to report, examples of inherent modern slavery and human rights abuses in the technology sector, updates on its key policies and procedures to guide and respond to potential or actual instances of modern slavery. The training included a detailed review of some of the sourcing tools listed in this statement and how they specifically support Transurban in identifying salient risks in sourcing activities.
column20: Vendor Management team training, modern slavery, salient risk

column6: Security personnel trained in human rights policies or procedures
column13: Transurban conducted specific training for 15 employees in French-speaking Montreal, Canada. Transurban took this opportunity to build and tailor specific awareness training on modern slavery in a Canadian context. In French, one of Transurban's sustainability managers in Quebec delivered this session in person over a lunch-and-learn style engagement.

column6: Incidents of violations involving rights of indigenous peoples
column13: Transurban recognises its role in respecting, supporting and advancing human rights. In a Human Rights Policy, Transurban has set out how to fulfil its commitment to internationally recognised human rights and engage stakeholders to prevent and address any involvement in negative human rights impacts. It also encourages action to create and promote positive human rights outcomes.
column20: Human Rights Policy, human rights impact, stakeholder engagement

column6: Operations that have been subject to human rights reviews or impacts assessments

Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Transurban extended its Re:act partnership with universities in Melbourne, Sydney and Brisbane to the University of Maryland (US) and joined the Australian Re:act TAFE program. Re:act gives students real-life briefs to develop a creative behaviour change campaign focusing on road safety issues impacting their age group.
column20: Re:act, University of Maryland, TAFE Program

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Transurban's North American team worked with Safe Kids Worldwide Fairfax County, State Farm insurance agents and local police, offering free child safety checks at an event along Virginia's 95 Express Lanes corridor. Certified child passenger safety technicians fitted seats, and families needing a car seat could drive away with a new one after Transurban donated 100 car seats, ensuring kids in local communities are safe and secure for every trip.
column20: Safe Kids Worldwide Fairfax County, child safety check, car seat

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In Canada, Transurban's Operation Red Nose is a seasonal safe-ride program (late November to New Year's Eve) that chauffeurs Canadians home when they have been drinking or don't feel safe driving. Service users are welcome to give back by donating to the non-profit.
column20: Operation Red Nose, safe-ride program, donation

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In North America, Transurban continues to engage with residents neighbouring its projects about project updates and specific activities, including its grant programs. As part of the Fredericksburg Extension Project, Transurban invested USD 66,000 in grants for FY23, including Fredericksburg Public Schools, to build outdoor classrooms, highlighting tree plantings and plans for environmental educational activities.
column20: Fredericksburg Extension Project, grant program, public school
